results.title: Effect of total cholesterol and statin therapy on mortality in ARDS patients: a secondary analysis of the SAILS and HARP-2 trials
results.text_hl: ...Two @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012128 @@@acute respiratory distress syndrome@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012128 @@@ARDS@@@) trials showed no benefit for statin therapy, though secondary analyses suggest @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ subphenotypes may have a differential response to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

results.title: Baseline plasma IL-18 may predict simvastatin treatment response in patients with ARDS: a secondary analysis of the HARP-2 randomised clinical trial
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ has been studied as a therapy for @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012128 @@@ARDS@@@ because of its pleiotropic effects.

results.title: Elevated ferritin, mediated by IL-18 is associated with systemic inflammation and mortality in acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
results.text_hl: Our aim was to determine if raised ferritin identified a subphenotype in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012128 @@@ARDS@@@. METHODS: Baseline plasma ferritin concentrations were measured in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012128 @@@ARDS@@@ from two randomised controlled trials of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@Hydroxymethylglutaryl-CoA Reductase@@@ Inhibition with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ in @DISEASE_Acute_Lung_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D055371 @@@Acute Lung Injury@@@ to Reduce @DISEASE_614113 @DISEASE_OMIM:614113 @@@Pulmonary Dysfunction-2@@@ (@DISEASE_Encephalitis_Herpes_Simplex @DISEASE_MESH:D020803 @@@HARP-2@@@); discovery cohort, UK) and @DISEASE_Neuromuscular_Manifestations @DISEASE_MESH:D020879 @@@neuromuscular blockade@@@ (ROSE; validation cohort, USA).

citations.NLM: Mehta P, Samanta RJ, Wick K, Coll RC, Mawhinney T, McAleavey PG, Boyle AJ, Conlon J, Shankar-Hari M, Rogers A, Calfee CS, Matthay MA, Summers C, Chambers RC, McAuley DF, O'Kane CM. Elevated ferritin, mediated by IL-18 is associated with systemic inflammation and mortality in acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS). Thorax. 2023 Dec 26;():. PMID: 38148147
citations.BibTeX: @article{38148147, title={Elevated ferritin, mediated by IL-18 is associated with systemic inflammation and mortality in acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).}, author={Mehta P and Samanta RJ and Wick K and Coll RC and Mawhinney T and McAleavey PG and Boyle AJ and Conlon J and Shankar-Hari M and Rogers A and Calfee CS and Matthay MA and Summers C and Chambers RC and McAuley DF and O'Kane CM}, journal={Thorax}}

results.title: Potential Impact of Subphenotyping in Pharmacologic Management of Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome.
results.text_hl: Neuromuscular blocking agents, corticosteroids, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ have resulted in a mortality benefit when used in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with the @DISEASE_Job_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D007589 @@@hyper@@@-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012128 @@@ARDS@@@ subphenotype.

citations.NLM: Torbic H, Bulgarelli L, Deliberato RO, Duggal A. Potential Impact of Subphenotyping in Pharmacologic Management of Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome. J Pharm Pract. 2023 Jun 19;():8971900231185392. PMID: 37337327

results.title: Prevalence of phenotypes of acute respiratory distress syndrome in critically ill patients with COVID-19: a prospective observational study
results.text_hl: Data from this cohort was compared with @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012128 @@@ARDS@@@ due to causes other than @DISEASE_COVID_19 @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@ recruited to a previous UK multicentre, randomised controlled trial of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (HARP-2).

results.title: Elevated Plasma Interleukin-18 Identifies High-Risk Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome Patients not Distinguished by Prior Latent Class Analyses Using Traditional Inflammatory Cytokines: A Retrospective Analysis of Two Randomized Clinical Trials.
results.text_hl: DESIGN: Statins for @DISEASE_Acute_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000208 @@@acutely@@@ injured @DISEASE_Lung_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008171 @@@lungs@@@ from @DISEASE_Sepsis @DISEASE_MESH:D018805 @@@sepsis@@@ (@DISEASE_Acute_Lung_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D055371 @@@SAILS@@@) and @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@hydroxymethylglutaryl-CoA reductase@@@ inhibition with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in @DISEASE_Acute_Lung_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D055371 @@@acute lung injury@@@ to reduce @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Heart_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D011660 @@@pulmonary dysfunction@@@ trial (HARP-2) are two large randomized, controlled trials in @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012128 @@@ARDS@@@ in which both LCA assignments and @GENE_IL18 @GENE_3606 @@@IL-18@@@ levels were shown to predict mortality.
